column4: Why am I unable to find testdisk in the synaptic package manager?
what does "apt-cache policy testdisk | grep Candidate" say?
you type that in a terminal
it says "W: Unable to locate package testdisk"
ok, pastebin the contents of your /etc/apt/sources.list file
how do I perform an interrogatory of sources.list?
did I miss that source.list line addition?
i didn't add anything, i just uncommented some lines
when you've saved your new sources.list, type "sudo apt-get update", then you should be able to install testdisk
ah k. would a reboot do the same thing?
if i wasnt using the live-on
